properties.displayName: Cloud Security Alliance Cloud Controls v4
properties.description: The Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) is a cybersecurity control framework for cloud computing aligned to the CSA best practices, that is considered the de-facto standard for cloud security and privacy.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc-connected servers when evaluating guest configuration policies
metadata.description: By selecting 'true,' you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/policy-pricing

metadata.displayName: Status if Windows Defender is not available on machine
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.

metadata.displayName: Minimum TLS version for Windows web servers
metadata.description: Windows web servers with lower TLS versions will be assessed as non-compliant

metadata.displayName: Required retention period (days) for resource logs
Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed images
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces excluded from evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces included for evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to (only) include for policy evaluation; an empty list will result in policies evaluated on all resources in all namespaces

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector for resources included for evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources to include for policy evaluation; an empty label selector will result in policies evaluated on all Kubernetes resources

metadata.displayName: Allowed container images for Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: Regular expression used to match allowed container images in a Kubernetes cluster; Ex: allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^.+azurecr.io/.+$

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes containers excluded from evaluation of policy: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The list should use the container name. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster services should listen only on allowed ports
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Allowed listener ports for Kubernetes cluster services
metadata.description: The list of ports on which Kubernetes cluster services are allowed to listen

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers CPU and memory resource limits should not exceed the specified limits
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Maximum allowed CPU units for containers in Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: Ex: 200m; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Maximum allowed memory (bytes) for a container in Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: Ex: 1Gi; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster pods and containers should only run with approved user and group IDs
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Run as user rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'RunAsUser' rule that containers are allowed to run with; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed user ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: User ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Run as group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'RunAsGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed group ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: Group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Supplemental group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'SupplementalGroups' rule that containers are allowed to run with; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed supplemental group ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: Supplemental group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: File system group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'FSGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed file system group ID ranges for Kubernetes cluster pods
metadata.description: File system group ranges that are allowed for pods to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should not share host process ID or host IPC namespace
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should run with a read only root file system
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed capabilities
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: List of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a Kubernetes cluster container
metadata.description: Use an empty list as input to block everything

metadata.displayName: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a Kubernetes cluster container
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed AppArmor profiles
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: The list of AppArmor profiles that containers are allowed to use
metadata.description: Ex: 'runtime/default;docker/default'; use an empty list as input to block everything; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster pods should only use approved host network and port range
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Allow host network usage for Kubernetes cluster pods
metadata.description: Set this value to true if pod is allowed to use host network, otherwise set to false; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Minimum value in the allowable host port range that Kubernetes cluster pods can use in the host network namespace
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Maximum value in the allowable host port range that Kubernetes cluster pods can use in the host network namespace
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster pod hostPath volumes should only use allowed host paths
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Allowed host paths for pod hostPath volumes to use
metadata.description: Use an empty paths list to block all host paths; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Name of the resource group for Network Watcher
metadata.description: Name of the resource group where Network Watchers are located, Ex: NetworkWatcherRG

metadata.displayName: Required auditing setting for SQL servers
API Management SKUs that should use a virtual network
metadata.description: List of API Management SKUs against which this policy will be evaluated

metadata.displayName: Maximum validity (months) for Key Vault certificates
metadata.description: The limit for how long a Key Vault certificate may be valid; Azure best practices recommend against certificates with lengthy validity periods

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Certificates should have the specified maximum validity period
